question: Which of the following is the criterion for a political party to be recognized as a national party?
option1: When it contests elections in all the States of the country
option2: When it secures at least five per cent of the total votes cast in a national election
option3: If it captures power at least in three States
option4: If it is recognized as a political party in four or more States
answer: If it is recognized as a political party in four or more States
explanation: A registered party is recognized as a national party only if it fulfils any one of the following three conditions: At a general election to Lok Sabha or Legislative Assembly, the party polls 6% of votes in any four or more states and in addition it wins four Lok Sabha seats.
